alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 1:02PM MDT until August 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Columbia. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of the lower lying agricultural areas begins * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 03/21/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. Thursday morning at 700 AM CDT.
